qas.question: When did "Superstorm Sandy" strike Atlantic City?
"Superstorm Sandy" produced an all-time record low barometric pressure reading of what?
Although "Superstorm Sandy" left minimal damage to any of the tourist areas it did cause what two other things to occur?
What was the source of the misinformation concerning damage to the city's boardwalk?
Why was there a photo of the Boardwalk if it wasn't actually damaged in the storm?

answers.text: the Boardwalk that was slated for repairs, prior to the storm

context: "Superstorm Sandy" struck Atlantic City on <a0_0>October 29, 2012<a0_0/>, causing <a2_0>flooding and power-outages<a2_0/> but left minimal damage to any of the tourist areas including the Boardwalk and casino resorts, despite widespread belief that the city's boardwalk had been destroyed. The source of the misinformation was a widely circulated <a3_0>photograph<a3_0/> of a damaged section of <a4_0>the Boardwalk that was slated for repairs, prior to the storm<a4_0/>, and incorrect news reports at the time of the disaster. The storm produced an all-time record low barometric pressure reading of <a1_0>943 mb<a1_0/> (27.85") for not only Atlantic City, but the state of New Jersey.
